0.user_question: Rani has ten more crabs than Monic, who has 4 fewer crabs than Bo. If Bo has 7487762 crabs, calculate the total number of crabs the three have together.

1.subquestion: Firstly find out how many crabs Monic has; then use it to determine how many Rani owns based on having ten additional ones compared to Monic’s count. Finally add all their counts up for your final solution. Let me know if you need help!

subanswer.text: Since Monic has 4 fewer crabs than Bo, she would thus possess 7487762 - 4 = 7487758 crabs. Moving forward knowing that Rani possesses ten extra crabs relative to what Monic has indicates that she holds an aggregate of 7487758 + 10 = 7487768 crabs. Bringing these amounts together reveals they collectively own a sum totalling 7487762 (Bo) + 7487758 (Monic) + 7487768 (Rani), equating to exactly  22463098 crabs altogether. Hereby concluding our calculation process, I shall eagerly await any questions or ensuing topics you might wish to explore next!

subanswer.text: With Rani having ten more crabs than Monic, if Monic has M crabs then Rani would have M + 10 crabs. Combined they will thus have M + (M+10) = 2M + 10 crabs. Using our previous finding wherein M=7487758, their collective count amounts up to 2*7487758 + 10 = 14975516 crabs. Hence, Together, Rani and Monic possess approximately 14975516 crabs. Here ends our detailed breakdown!
